review_title: The worst place to work in the world
pros: Other than the other faculty, there is nothing good about YSU.
cons: Where to begin with a list of cons?! In their ideal world, the administration would like to replace all full-time faculty with adjuncts -- thus avoid paying a living wage. They imagine the role of a university to be a trade school, rather than the more typical trade school. I'll be surprised if the university is around in 20 years.

pros: I was given a lot of freedom to grow. But I think with budget issues, that decreased over time.

pros: Good place to teach as an adjunct

review_title: Awesome department, but tricky because its a union school
pros: YSU is undergoing some major changes including increasing student quality level, increasing faculty expectations, and all around holding everyone to higher standards. Generally speaking, I feel like the leadership is being handled well and we are going in the right direction which makes this a very exciting time to be at YSU. Furthermore, I really enjoy the people I work with and the general level of collaboration in my department.
cons: Because it is a union school, a lot of the support staff are not as productive or positive as you might find elsewhere. Sometimes it takes a long time to get simple things done. For example, it took about 2 months for me to finally get my office key.

pros: YSU's spirit of community is palpable.  It may sound trite, but it's true.  There is a sincere sense of "togetherness" and Penguin pride that was far and away the most pleasant aspect of my YSU experience.  This cuts across roles on campus: students, TAs, clerical staff, support staff, instructors, professors, and the administration.  YSU students/graduates can and do excel nationally, indeed globally.  If you're hiring and are looking for intelligent, well mannered recruits with strong work ethic ... look to YSU.  If you're an aspiring student who wants a quality education that is one of the nation's best values ... choose YSU.
cons: Parking ... Just a current nit, and it's being addressed.

review_title: People are good, University Administration does not care
pros: Many of the people working at the University are good and hard working people very dedicated to their jobs.
cons: Upper management and university administration have no value of people within the organization. The administration always maintains an attitude of "us vs. them" in terms of the employees and would rather work against staff rather than with them. The work environment used to be much better, however over the last 10 years that work environment has become very toxic and the administration has decided to stick together in their attitudes against the staff.

pros: Worked around school schedule, made friends
cons: Management is honestly some of the worst I’ve ever dealt with. Student jobs are supposed to be chill. The area where I worked wouldn’t let us do homework when all the other areas could. We were constantly watched on the cameras because management didn’t have anything better to do. They only hire managers that went to/graduated from YSU and a lot of the times they’re young and hate to say it, but don’t have managerial ability. My one boss took a vacation every single month. Never saw him. Hours are constantly cut to accommodate new hires, when we are already fully staffed. Great job if you wanna make $50 per week.

review_title: Great Environment and Fostering of Educational Values
job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Youngstown, OH
pros: I enjoyed working with the students here as an adjunct faculty member. My particular department worked tirelessly to foster important educational values to the students it serves through departmental services and course offerings.
cons: The pay, while decent for the Youngstown area, could use some improvement. From my understanding, it has been many many years since the adjunct faculty have seen a raise- upwards of 20+ years.

job_title: Tech Desk Student Assistant in Youngstown, OH
pros: As a student, working while on campus is a huge pro. You can work between classes, before, or after. its very easy to fit in the Maximum number of hours allowed per week. Everyone is pretty lax about if you have tests coming up and you need to study, or take a day off. you gain great experience too.
cons: There really aren't any cons. I couldn't complain about anything.The biggest con would be that it is only minimum wage, which even that is absolutely fine.

job_title: Student Administrative Assistant in Youngstown, OH
pros:
Learn future skills that will help you in future careers 
Work with friendly staff/professors 
Can do homework if nothing is assigned during your shift 
Network
cons:
Have to work with rude students during scheduling 
Have to do other student workers' work since they decided not to do assigned shift work
Have to be a buffer for Administrative Assistant, if working in the office
Have to hear other students complain about assignments and teachers

job_title: Part-Time Professor, English Department in Youngstown, OH
pros: Love teaching-- kind people on staff, great students, safe and enthusiastic learning environment. Good pay for hours worked, and very manageable time wise to suit a hectic lifestyle.
cons: No health care for part time, no summer work for part time, no assistance or guarantee of hours from semester to semester. Although it has good pay, it is not a job that is stable nor reliable.

pros: The position of Design Editor is a great learning experience for a new designer. The Jambar is a real world environment with the security of a learning environment.
cons: The only con for this position is that there is not a set of guides for newly in charge editors. It is up to them to figure out things that should probably be written down for them.

pros: State benefits, vacation (but only if you are allowed to take it and it doesn't get revoked as a cost savings).
cons: University is encased with union politics, administration that is self-serving, and the idea that the "way we always do it" is the future even though they are in huge financial debt.  To be honest, I would be shocked if the university survives another 5-10 years.  Mandatory furlough days, revoking of vacation days, salary freezes, decreased benefits, higher out of pocket costs...all with subpar leadership.  No thanks.

job_title: Student Service Desk in Youngstown, OH
pros: The experience has been great and the salary is competitive for a student wage. Working at the service desk is one of the highest paying student jobs on campus and allows you to gain great experience towards a future in IT.
cons: Sometimes the department can be a little unorganized which can be expected working in the IT world. Every time there is something new on the market, it can be a little chaotic updating to the times. But I've loved my time at YSU and hope it continues.

review_title: Good place to work and study at the same time
pros: I was an international student while I was working there at the same time. The good thing about working there is you get to learn what you want to learn anytime and at the same time because of flexible schedule it is easy to manage your job and study.
cons: There are not many opportunities for international students. Very limited resources for international students.

job_title: Student Office Worker in Youngstown, OH
pros: Great environment in the human resources office, staff is very friendly and eager to help whenever you need it, student office assistants will have some down time, flexible with schedules for tests/exams
cons: Student office assistants do have to work during university breaks (spring break and summer/winter), sometimes you will have to walk outgoing mail across campus which could be a con for some

job_title: Student Office Assistant in Youngstown, OH
pros:
Very simple job.
Very simple pace.
Duties will become repetitive.
Lot's of time to work on other things.
You get the use of a computer for work.
You get to eat at your desk.
cons:
Faculty may treat you rudely.
Duties will become repetitive.
Minimum wage.
You will have to walk a lot.
You will have to make lots of copies.
Job security is tenuous from semester to semester.

review_title: Few complaints, not a bad place to be.
job_title: Network Security Analyst in Youngstown, OH
pros: Great benefits, lots of good people. Low stress environment. Free tuition. Rec center. Nice campus.
cons: Union drama. Some people complain about what they have and have no idea what others have to pay or deal with outside in the private sector. Frustrating to see ineffective people skate by making lots of money when they don't and can't contribute

pros: Early registration, paid to study when there's no work to do, network and build relationships with faculty, extremely flexible schedule.
cons: Low wages (understandably), an obvious frustration of full-time staff and faculty with administrators.

pros: Classes at Youngstown State University are small (between 15-50 students) and you have free reign to instruct your class the way you want.
cons: The pay is low compared to other state universities in the region and the technology in some of the lecture rooms are not adequate.

pros: It was a great experience. I learned a lot and it paid for 2/3 of my MBA and received a stipend.
cons: Cannot hold another job at the same time, need to be flexible in schedule and work environment as you are not provided a "permanent" designated work space.

pros: Great work environment, laid back employees but still get alot of production. Majority of staff members are friendly and the University is working hard to obtain a more prestigious reputation. Jim Tressel is the current President!
cons: Top-heavy structure, there are way too many administrators in relation to the amount of employees. Witnessed violations regarding union contracts with no compensation. People can be fired without sufficient notice.

pros: Was given the freedom to develop my own lesson plan. The department chair was easy to work with. All of the professors and instructors were helpful and friendly. Rewarding to teach undergraduates who were anxious to learn. Overall, it was a great university environment.
cons: Some of the technology (computers, classroom teaching aids) was outdated, pay was low for part-time instructors. No benefits for part-time instructors.

review_title: Many on campus job opportunities for students
pros:
The flexibility
Ability to learn
Study time offered on downtime (at least in the departments I was in).
cons: Depending on where you work it can vary. For the department I worked in there was a certain professor who always would act as if I was a young child.

pros: Dedicated teachers and wonderful students
cons: The director is very unprofessional and is more concerned with her public image than what is actually going on with the staff and students.  While portrayed as a school, The Rich Center is a daycare center which falls under the direction of Ohio Jobs and Family Services.

pros: Laid-back, easy-going work environment with a decent amount of work available as a Student worker.  Conducive learning environment and early class registration is a benefit too.
cons: Understaffed, thus it can be difficult to find information or assistance sometimes; will need to be able to function independently.  Also, appears to be slow moving on some technology.

pros: loved beign able to work on campus not far from classes and everything. People were great to work with and campus is very safe
cons: Long, awkward hours sometimes word

job_title: Mechanical Design Engineer in Salem, OH
pros: I worked in the Student Tutoring center through 2010. The schedule was convenient and worked well around my class schedule. The experience looked good on my resume.
cons: The pay is very poor and the work is often repetative. You will spend many hours answering the same questions over and over. I really only recommend this if you are fairly patient.

pros: Flexible hours and moderate pay. They accommodate your school schedule and work with you to find a time that is beneficial for you to work.
cons: If you are paired up with an advisor that is not easy to get along with/understand you can have a bad experience that dissuades you from continuing research at a higher level.

pros: The salary is great for the cost of living in Youngstown area
cons: Complete lack of reinforcement for a job well done or going above-and-beyond, culture of area and university encourages doing the bare minimum, as an open-access university many students GREATLY underprepared for college, disconnect between faculty/admin

pros: I was a student technician and I learned a lot from being on the job. As a student, there wasn't advancement opportunities, but it was still a good place to learn.
cons: Biggest downside was lack of communication between departments and how nothing seemed very cohesive.

Worked only during office hours

review_title: Great university, nice to have a part time job while attending

pros: It is a wonderful opportunity for me to work as a graduate assistant here in YSU. I am teaching some labs also which is helping me develop teaching skills.
